text: The Alhambra Cup was a football competition played for two seasons between clubs in the Irish League in 1921-22 and 1922-23. Six teams entered each season: Cliftonville, Distillery, Glenavon, Glentoran, Linfield and Queen's Island. ==Final results== {| class="wikitable" |- !Season !Date !Winner !Score !Runner-up !Venue |- align=center |1921–22 |7 September 1921 |Linfield |1 - 0 |Cliftonville |The Oval, Belfast |- align=center |1922–23 |30 August 1922 |Cliftonville |2 - 0 |Linfield |The Oval, Belfast |} ==Sources== *Malcolm Brodie, "100 Years of Irish Football", Blackstaff Press, Belfast (1980) ==References== Category:Defunct association football cup competitions in Northern Ireland
title: Alhambra Cup
